title: Tom Fills
description: Learn to create drum fills using toms — the exciting transitions between sections.

steps.title: What is a Fill?
steps.description: A drum fill is a short break from the main beat, usually lasting 1-2 beats. Fills use toms, snare, and crash to create excitement and signal transitions. Think of fills as punctuation marks in your drumming — they tell the listener 'something new is coming!'

steps.title: Tom Alone
steps.description: Hit the tom. Toms have a melodic, resonant quality between the snare and kick.

steps.title: Snare to Tom
steps.description: A classic fill move: snare then tom. Play them together here to practice the combination.

steps.title: Tom + Kick
steps.description: Tom with kick adds weight to the fill. This is often used at the bottom of a descending fill.

steps.title: Fill Ending: Tom + Crash
steps.description: A fill often ends with a crash on beat 1 of the next section. Play tom and crash together.

steps.title: Big Fill Ending
steps.description: The ultimate fill ending: kick + crash together. This marks the transition point from fill back to the groove.

steps.title: Fill Quiz
steps.description: What is the purpose of a drum fill?
